Reviews.Title: “modern but soul less”
Reviews.Author: david m
Reviews.Content: very modrn and stylish hotel,we atayed while passing through madrid during summer tour of Spain. Situated in a very run down and industrial looking area of the city,we took a wronh turn out of the hotel and ended up in the bronx ! Cars with smashed windows along the whole length of the street. The hotel itself is very comfortable and has all mod cons.Fine for passing through,just get good directions if venturing outside hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Nice ultra modern hotel but a good way out of town”
Reviews.Author: nickyg24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business as it was close to the office. It is a really stylish, modern hotel with helpful staff and good food (excellent value for money for the room service meal that I had). It is a way out of town and there are not many shops nearby. Free wifi in the rooms which was good. No other facilities like a gym or swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient but soulless business hotel”
Reviews.Author: restlessmover
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms that are comfortable enough but nothing special. The bed was a bit on the hard side so sleep quality was not the best I have ever had. I could do with better internet access - these days people travel with two or three internet enabled devices but (like most places) you can only use one at a time here. The air conditioning seems to be switched off so there is no air circulation unless you open the window and let in the street noise together with the fresh air. The food offering is pretty bad. The breakfast buffet looks impressive but actually the quality of ingredients and materials on offer are pretty poor - better to go one of the cafes in the area for breakfast and somewhere else completely for dinner. Last time i was here I had a room service salad and fruit platter for dinner.....and a dodgy tummy in the morning. I can't prove a link but ....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for business traveler.”
Reviews.Author: georgeny01
Reviews.Content: Overall me and my wife went to Madrid on vacation. I decided to stay at theBarcelo Hotel because it seem the price was right. Eventhough the rooms were clean and the staff was eager to help we found ourselves in the middle of commercial industry. It felt I was not on vacation. We did rent a car and went all over. The sorrownding area was a bit noisy due to the industry at work. I felt I was not on vacation. I don't mind the noise, as long as it was noise from people going about their busness. Not trucks loading and unloading during the day. This hotel is a nice place but, not for vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Business Area”
Reviews.Author: Traveling__Tiger_201
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a good 4 star standard. Good breakfast is not included in the price but you can choose between two options. Full buffet breakfast and a light continental one. Service is good and cable internet is included in the room rate. If you don't like the hotel restaurant you have to go downtown to eat, since there is no other restaurant near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What one would expect.. but slightly better.”
Reviews.Author: Bill D
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Madrid on business, and this hotel was within a few hunderd meters of the two locations I need to be at. Having stayed in Barcelo hotels in the UK I expected the standard to be good even in a business type hotel. I wasn't disapointed. The hotel is modern, purpose built and quite stylish. Room had every I needed, buffet breakfast was good and the evening meal choice was excellent and well presented. Helpful staff and a enjoyable stay. Very easy access to the airport and the Metro is a few hunderd meters down the street, you can be in the city centre in a no time at all. I will use it again for sure, and would even consider it for a weekend break, it won't break the budget.

Reviews.Title: “business hotel comodo e confortevole”
Reviews.Author: Ita_Traveller
Reviews.Content: be on a business trip in this hotel. it was in a good position for my business needs and room quite comfortable. modern design and clean. internet free by cable in the room. free wireless in the reception. people at reception kind. it was a positive stay. Breakfast not included in standard rate. I didn’t try the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A long way out of town”
Reviews.Author: marduk1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on business. The hotel was pleasant with helpful staff and a nice breakfast but there are no shops, restaurants or night life nearby. To get into central Madrid takes 25 minutes and a taxi (20 Euros) and up to an hour on a bus (2 Euros).

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: qwerty95
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, spacious rooms. Probably cleanest hotel ever stayed in. Good airconditioning Free internet (although have to request cable from reception) Not central to Madrid but good location for business in the area. Restaurant limited choice. No coffee tea making facilities in room

Reviews.Title: “Cool Business Hotel! Great design!”
Reviews.Author: ABCTigers
Reviews.Content: Very tendy, clean and practical business hotel. Everything you need. Should definitely take up cooperation with the gym vis-a-vis

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Far from the City Center”
Reviews.Author: Lazaroz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clear, the staff was excellent. The rooms are big enough. The breakfast was very nice. The hotel was outside of the city center but there is a bus stop outside of the hotel and a metro station five minutes walking from the hotel, so there was a way to go without spend a lot of money to the city center

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you have business in the area”
Reviews.Author: november_moon
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is a bit off the beaten track, but if you have business with one of the companies nearby, it is a good choice. And there is a Metro station within a 5-10 minute walk, so trips to the city center are easy. The ride takes about 30 minutes. The hotel itself is good - clean, reasonably comfortable, excellent staff, and a decent restaurant. The decor is a little too spartan for my taste - very white, almost anticeptic.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SilviuAgoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a week in March 2010. A very good hotel, clean, 5 minutes easy walk from the subway station Virgen del Cotijo. The staff is very friendly! The hotel has 6 floors with 24 rooms each / floor At ground zero it has the reception, the restaurant and a free Internet poit ! Room is spacious, we had bathroom, Samsung LCD TV, desk, air conditioning, mini bar! The bed is very large and comfortable, even if sometimes squeak! We recommend this hotel, both in terms of price and the conditions offered!

Reviews.Title: “Good Standard Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SussexAdventurers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights whilst atending a conference. The hotel is modern (don't expect too much in the way of style) and situated in a quietish part of the city. It is relatively easliy reachable using the excellent Metro system, but quite a long way from the centre of Madrid. My room was comfortable and well set-up for business users. The (wired) internet worked fine. However the aircon was barely up to the task - and this was in October so I don't know what it would have been like in the summer. The breakfast buffet was OK with a decent variety of dishes on offer. Overall, good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience @ Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JayMurlee
Reviews.Content: This hotel belongs to the Barcelo Group. So, needless to explain the hospitality...

Reviews.Title: “Manager on top of every detail. Perfect personnel,attitudes,value!”
Reviews.Author: Ingie39
Reviews.Content: Front desk totally efficient in many languages and pleasant. All staff keen to help and please. Hotel spotless..even in the corners! Everything in the room works perfectly. Modern and welcoming "home" in Madrid. This year was not my first stay and I will return for sure! It is "my place" in Madrid. Amazed when staff remembered me from last year's visit and even the right chocolates were in my room. Manager definitely has eye for details.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Viajera711
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to Valladolid but flew into Barajas Airport in Madrid and had to stay a night. I found this hotel at cheaprooms.com, so I figured it would be adequate, but not fantastic, but the hotel was amazing! The front desk people were very helpful and when they could tell we didnt speak much spanish they spoke english with us easily. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were spacious and modern. There is internet connection, but you have to ask them for a cord (which is free). They also have a restaurant on the bottom floor which was good. When I couldn't figure out how to use the telephone, they just let me use their front desk phone at no charge. It is in the business district, however, so it wasn't really close to anything, and the metro stop was a little walk away, but not bad at all and I liked being away from the hustle of the city because it was so quiet! Excellent hotel, I plan to stay there again when I leave Spain!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but the decoration is too white, it's like waking up in a hospital.”
Reviews.Author: Esteven
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its convenient location (close to my customer and to the airport), but that's about all the positive I can say about the location. It's based in the middle of nowhere, you can't come out of the hotel just to have a drink in a bar somewhere close. The people are very friendly and the beds are exrtemely large and comfortable. The rooms are comfortable, large in size, good size bathroom, BUT, because of all the white (furniture, walls, lights) it's like waking up in a hospital. My bedside lamps were not working, so I had to switch on the big light in the morning and that's just horrible. Not everything was functionning in the room: phone, bedside lamps, safe. Inconvenient, because i asked a wake-up call! The buffet breakfast was very nice, only possitive things to say about it, but the breakfast room seems more like an IKEA cafetaria. The tried to make a design hotel out of it, but they forgot to give it any character. It's a missed opportunity, because it's a brand new hotel. I will not go back. There's better options in the Madrid area for the same price.

HotelInfo.Name: Barcelo Castellana Norte
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida de Manoteras 20, 28050 Madrid, Spain
